# Product Requirements Document (PRD) Template

This template demonstrates the structure expected by the Documentation Backfill tool. The tool automatically extracts these sections from Confluence pages or other sources.

## Document Information

**Title:** [Feature Name]  
**Status:** [Draft/Review/Approved]  
**Owner:** [Product Owner Name]  
**Date:** [YYYY-MM-DD]

---

## Target Population

**Target Population ID:** Target-Population

Describe the user segments that will benefit from this feature.

**Example:**
- Primary users: Customer service representatives
- Secondary users: Account managers
- Estimated impact: ~500 active users

---

## Target Description

**Target Description ID:** Target-Description

Provide detailed description of the target user personas and their characteristics.

---

## User Value

**User Value ID:** User-Value

Explain the value proposition for end users.

### User Problem Definition

**User Problem Definition ID:** User-Problem-Definition

Describe the specific problem users are facing.

**Example:**
Users currently struggle with [specific problem] which causes [negative impact]. This problem occurs when [context/scenario].

### User Problem Frequency

**User Problem Frequency ID:** User-Problem-Frequency

How often does this problem occur?

**Example:**
- Daily: ~200 occurrences
- Weekly: ~1,400 occurrences
- Monthly: ~6,000 occurrences

### User Problem Severity

**User Problem Severity ID:** User-Problem-Severity

What is the impact severity of this problem?

**Example:**
- High: Blocks critical workflows
- Medium: Causes significant frustration
- Low: Minor inconvenience

---

## Business Value

**Business Value ID:** Business-Value

Explain the business impact and value of solving this problem.

### Business Impact

**Business Impact ID:** Business-Impact

Quantify the business impact.

**Example:**
- Increased customer satisfaction: +15% NPS
- Reduced support tickets: -30%
- Revenue impact: +$50K/month

### Strategic Impact

**Strategic Impact ID:** Strategic-Impact

How does this align with strategic goals?

**Example:**
- Supports company goal: Improve customer experience
- Enables future feature: [Related feature]
- Competitive advantage: [Benefit]

---

## Proposed Solution

**Proposed Solution ID:** Proposed-solution

Describe the proposed solution in detail.

### Description & Flow

**Description & Flow ID:** Description-&-Flow

Explain how the solution works and the user flow.

**Example:**
1. User initiates action
2. System processes request
3. User receives confirmation
4. [Additional steps]

### Mockup & Design

**Mockup & Design ID:** Mockup-&-Design

Link to design mockups, wireframes, or visual references.

**Example:**
- Figma link: [URL]
- Design system components used
- User interface mockups

### Technical Documentation

**Technical Documentation ID:** Technical-Documentation

Link to technical specifications, API docs, or architecture diagrams.

**Example:**
- API specification: [URL]
- Database schema: [URL]
- Architecture diagram: [URL]

---

## Success Criteria

**Success Criteria ID:** Success-Criteria

Define measurable success metrics.

**Example:**
- Adoption rate: 80% of target users within 3 months
- Performance: Page load time < 2 seconds
- Quality: Error rate < 1%
- User satisfaction: NPS score > 50

---

## Constraints & Limitations

**Constraints & Limitations ID:** Constraints-&-Limitation

List any constraints, limitations, or out-of-scope items.

**Example:**
- Not supported on mobile browsers
- Limited to specific user roles
- Requires existing feature X to be enabled
- Out of scope: [Feature Y]

---

## Supporting Documents

**Supporting Documents ID:** Supporting-Documents

Links to related documents, research, or references.

**Example:**
- User research: [URL]
- Competitive analysis: [URL]
- Technical RFC: [URL]
- Related PRDs: [URL]

---

## User Stories

**User Stories ID:** User-Stories

Detailed user stories and acceptance criteria.

**Example:**

### Story 1: [Story Title]
**As a** [user type]  
**I want** [action/goal]  
**So that** [benefit/value]

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Criterion 1
- [ ] Criterion 2
- [ ] Criterion 3

### Story 2: [Story Title]
[Repeat format above]

---

## Notes

- This template uses Confluence heading IDs (e.g., `id="Target-Population"`) for optimal extraction
- The tool can also extract content using heading text patterns
- All sections are optional, but more sections provide better context for description generation
- Use clear, descriptive headings to ensure proper extraction
